Table of Contents

Class OqsCore

Namespace
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.Core
Assembly
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.Core.dll

Provides a managed C# wrapper for the liboqs native library, offering a safe and convenient interface for post-quantum cryptographic operations. This static class includes methods for initializing and cleaning up the library, managing memory securely, generating random data, and accessing CPU features.

public static class OqsCore

Methods

AllocateMemory(nuint)

Allocates memory using LibOQS's memory allocator. Memory allocated with this method should be freed with FreeMemory(nint, nuint).

public static nint AllocateMemory(nuint size)

Parameters

size nuint

The size in bytes to allocate.

Returns

nint

A pointer to the allocated memory.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if size is zero or exceeds the maximum allowed size (1GB).

OutOfMemoryException

Thrown if allocation fails.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

Calloc(nuint, nuint)

Allocates zero-initialized memory using the system's calloc function. Use this when you need memory initialized to zero.

public static nint Calloc(nuint numElements, nuint elementSize)

Parameters

numElements nuint

The number of elements to allocate.

elementSize nuint

The size of each element in bytes.

Returns

nint

A pointer to the allocated and zero-initialized memory.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if parameters are invalid.

OutOfMemoryException

Thrown if allocation fails.

CleanseMemory(nint, nuint)

Securely clears memory by overwriting it with zeros. This operation cannot be optimized away by the compiler, making it suitable for clearing sensitive data.

public static void CleanseMemory(nint memPtr, nuint size)

Parameters

memPtr nint

Pointer to the memory to cleanse. Safe to pass IntPtr.Zero.

size nuint

The size in bytes of the memory to cleanse.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

CreateSecureByteArray(int)

Creates a secure byte array that automatically clears its contents when disposed. This is ideal for storing sensitive cryptographic material.

public static SecureByteArray CreateSecureByteArray(int length)

Parameters

length int

The length of the array to create. Maximum 1MB.

Returns

SecureByteArray

A SecureByteArray instance that will securely clear its contents on disposal.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if length is negative or exceeds 1MB.

CreateSecureByteArray(ReadOnlySpan<byte>)

Creates a secure byte array from existing data, which will be securely cleared when disposed. The input data is defensively copied to prevent external modification.

public static SecureByteArray CreateSecureByteArray(ReadOnlySpan<byte> data)

Parameters

data ReadOnlySpan<byte>

The data to copy into the secure array.

Returns

SecureByteArray

A SecureByteArray instance containing a copy of the data.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if data length exceeds 1MB.

FreeMemory(nint, nuint)

Frees memory allocated by AllocateMemory(nuint) using secure free (clears memory first). This is the recommended method for freeing memory in cryptographic applications.

public static void FreeMemory(nint memPtr, nuint size)

Parameters

memPtr nint

Pointer to the memory to free. Safe to pass IntPtr.Zero.

size nuint

The size in bytes of the memory block.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

GenerateRandomBytes(int)

Generates a new byte array filled with cryptographically secure random bytes. Includes basic entropy validation for buffers between 4 and 1024 bytes.

public static byte[] GenerateRandomBytes(int length)

Parameters

length int

The number of random bytes to generate. Maximum 1MB.

Returns

byte[]

A new byte array containing cryptographically secure random bytes.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if length is negative or exceeds 1MB.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized or if entropy validation fails.

GenerateRandomBytes(Span<byte>)

Fills the provided buffer with cryptographically secure random bytes using LibOQS's random number generator.

public static void GenerateRandomBytes(Span<byte> buffer)

Parameters

buffer Span<byte>

The buffer to fill with random bytes. Empty buffers are safely ignored.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

GetMemoryUsageInfo(string)

Gets memory usage recommendations for the specified algorithm. This helps applications understand memory requirements and plan accordingly.

public static MemoryUsageInfo? GetMemoryUsageInfo(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The algorithm name to get memory information for.

Returns

MemoryUsageInfo?

A structure containing memory usage estimates, or null if the algorithm is unknown.

GetVersion()

Gets the version string of the liboqs library.

public static string GetVersion()

Returns

string

The version string of liboqs.

HasCpuExtension(OqsCpUext)

Checks whether the current CPU supports a specific extension that can accelerate cryptographic operations.

public static bool HasCpuExtension(OqsCpUext extension)

Parameters

extension OqsCpUext

The CPU extension to check for.

Returns

bool

True if the CPU extension is available, false otherwise.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

HintMemoryPressure(long, bool)

Provides a hint about memory pressure after completing large cryptographic operations. This can help optimize garbage collection and memory usage in memory-constrained scenarios.

public static void HintMemoryPressure(long bytesAllocated, bool forceGarbageCollection = false)

Parameters

bytesAllocated long

The approximate number of bytes that were allocated for the operation.

forceGarbageCollection bool

Whether to immediately trigger garbage collection. Use sparingly in performance-critical code.

Remarks

This method is useful when:

  • Working with large-key algorithms (Classic McEliece, some NTRU variants)
  • Processing operations in batches
  • Running in memory-constrained environments (containers, IoT devices)
  • Experiencing memory pressure or frequent GC pauses

Call this after completing cryptographic operations that allocated significant memory.

Initialize()

Initializes the LibOQS library. This method is thread-safe and should be called before using any other LibOQS functionality.

public static void Initialize()

InsecureFreeMemory(nint)

Frees memory without secure clearing. Use only for non-sensitive data. For sensitive data, use FreeMemory(nint, nuint) instead (which uses secure clearing).

public static void InsecureFreeMemory(nint memPtr)

Parameters

memPtr nint

Pointer to the memory to free. Safe to pass IntPtr.Zero.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

Malloc(nuint)

Allocates memory using the system's malloc function. Use this for temporary allocations when you need standard malloc behavior.

public static nint Malloc(nuint size)

Parameters

size nuint

The size in bytes to allocate.

Returns

nint

A pointer to the allocated memory.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if size is zero or too large.

OutOfMemoryException

Thrown if allocation fails.

RemoveMemoryPressure(long)

Removes memory pressure hint after memory has been freed. Call this to inform the GC that previously allocated cryptographic memory has been released.

public static void RemoveMemoryPressure(long bytesFreed)

Parameters

bytesFreed long

The number of bytes that were freed.

Remarks

This should typically be called automatically by disposal methods, but can be used manually when implementing custom memory management scenarios.

SecureCompare(nint, nint, nuint)

Performs a secure comparison of two memory blocks in constant time. This prevents timing attacks when comparing sensitive data like cryptographic secrets.

public static int SecureCompare(nint a, nint b, nuint length)

Parameters

a nint

Pointer to the first memory block.

b nint

Pointer to the second memory block.

length nuint

The length in bytes to compare.

Returns

int

0 if the memory blocks are equal, non-zero otherwise.

SwitchRandomAlgorithm(string)

Switches the random number generator algorithm used by LibOQS. Common algorithms include "OpenSSL", "NIST-DRBG", and system-specific options.

public static void SwitchRandomAlgorithm(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The name of the random algorithm to switch to.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Thrown if the algorithm name is null, empty, whitespace, or not supported.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if LibOQS has not been initialized.

ThreadStop()

Stops and cleans up resources for the current thread. This should be called when a thread that has used liboqs is about to terminate.

public static void ThreadStop()
